references.title: HTML AAM rules for the option element

assertions.title: The assistive technology MUST convey the name of the option
assertions.rationale: The user needs to know the purpose of the option.
examples: a screen reader will announce the name
voice control software will let the user say something like "click <name>" to activate the control

assertions.title: The assistive technology MUST convey the option role
assertions.rationale: The user needs to know that the element has option behavior.
examples: A screen reader might announce "option" as the role
A screen reader might not announce a role because the role is implied by the role of a select element or listbox
Voice control software will let the user say something like "choose <name>" to pick an option

assertions.title: The assistive technology MUST convey the value of the option when used in a datalist context
assertions.rationale: When in a datalist context, both the name and value are displayed, so the user needs to be aware of both.
